result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel T Liegler

records.addlTxt: Per Letter to Court from Defense Counsel dated 10/10/2022 requesting adjourned pretrial conference date, Court grants the 10/13/2022 pretrial conference to be rescheduled to 11/11/2022 at 9:00 a.m. by Zoom.
to Court from Defense Counsel Requesting Adjournment, filed.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain absolute sobriety, No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant Samuel T Liegler in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel T Liegler not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/21/22.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Samuel T Liegler not in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/7/22 @ 1:30p
